Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.client

Class HTTPClientConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.Connection
      • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.client.HTTPClientConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChannelHandler, H2FrameHandler
    public class HTTPClientConnection
extends Connection
implements H2FrameHandler
    HTTP client connection that handles protocol-level communication.

    This class manages a single HTTP connection to a server, supporting both HTTP/1.1 and HTTP/2 protocols. It provides factory methods for creating requests and handles the protocol-level details of sending requests and receiving responses.

    Instances are created internally by HTTPClient when a connection is established. Most applications should use the HTTPClient class directly rather than this class.

    Advanced Usage

    For advanced scenarios, the connection can be accessed via HTTPClient.getActiveConnection(): 

    
 HTTPClientConnection conn = client.getActiveConnection();
 if (conn != null) {
     // Access connection-level details
     HTTPVersion version = conn.getVersion();
 }
    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    HTTPClient, HTTPRequest

    • Constructor Detail

      • HTTPClientConnection

        public HTTPClientConnection​(HTTPClient client,
                            java.nio.channels.SocketChannel channel,
                            javax.net.ssl.SSLEngine engine,
                            boolean secure,
                            HTTPClientHandler handler)
        Creates an HTTP client connection.

        This constructor is called by HTTPClient.newConnection(java.nio.channels.SocketChannel, javax.net.ssl.SSLEngine, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ClientHandler) when establishing a new connection.

        Parameters:
        client - the parent HTTPClient
        channel - the socket channel for the connection
        engine - the SSL engine for TLS connections, or null for plaintext
        secure - whether this is a secure (TLS) connection
        handler - the handler to receive connection events

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen()
        Returns true if the connection is open and can accept new requests.

        Returns false after the connection is closed, after receiving a GOAWAY frame (HTTP/2), or after a fatal connection error.

        Overrides:
        isOpen in class Connection
        Returns:
        true if the connection is open

      • getVersion

        public HTTPVersion getVersion()
        Returns the negotiated HTTP version, or null if not yet connected.

        For TLS connections, the version is determined by ALPN negotiation during the TLS handshake. For plaintext connections, it depends on HTTP/2 upgrade negotiation or the server's response.

        Returns:
        the HTTP version, or null if not yet known

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the connection gracefully.

        For HTTP/2, this sends a GOAWAY frame allowing outstanding requests to complete. For HTTP/1.x, this closes the connection after any in-progress request completes.

        Overrides:
        close in class Connection

      • setH2Enabled

        public void setH2Enabled​(boolean enabled)
        Enables or disables HTTP/2 via ALPN for TLS connections.

        When enabled (the default), TLS connections will offer "h2" in ALPN negotiation, allowing the server to select HTTP/2 if it supports it.

        Disable this if you specifically need to use HTTP/1.1 over TLS.

        Note: This must be set before the connection is established. Changing it after TLS handshake has no effect.

        Parameters:
        enabled - true to offer HTTP/2 in ALPN negotiation

      • setH2cUpgradeEnabled

        public void setH2cUpgradeEnabled​(boolean enabled)
        Enables or disables h2c (HTTP/2 over cleartext) upgrade attempts.

        When enabled, the first request on a non-TLS connection will include h2c upgrade headers. If the server responds with 101 Switching Protocols, the connection switches to HTTP/2.

        Note: This is currently disabled by default because the server-side h2c upgrade implementation is incomplete. Enable only for testing or when connecting to servers with complete h2c support.

        Parameters:
        enabled - true to enable h2c upgrade attempts

      • setH2WithPriorKnowledge

        public void setH2WithPriorKnowledge​(boolean enabled)
        Enables or disables HTTP/2 with prior knowledge.

        When enabled on a plaintext (non-TLS) connection, the client will immediately send the HTTP/2 connection preface (PRI * HTTP/2.0...) upon connection establishment, without first attempting an h2c upgrade.

        This should only be enabled when you know the server supports HTTP/2, as the connection will fail if the server doesn't understand HTTP/2.

        Parameters:
        enabled - true to use HTTP/2 with prior knowledge

      • headersFrameReceived

        public void headersFrameReceived​(int streamId,
                                 boolean endStream,
                                 boolean endHeaders,
                                 int streamDependency,
                                 boolean exclusive,
                                 int weight,
                                 java.nio.ByteBuffer headerBlockFragment)
        Description copied from interface: H2FrameHandler
        Called when a HEADERS frame is received.
        Specified by:
        headersFrameReceived in interface H2FrameHandler
        Parameters:
        streamId - the stream identifier
        endStream - true if this is the last frame for the stream
        endHeaders - true if this completes the header block
        streamDependency - the stream dependency (0 if no priority)
        exclusive - true for exclusive stream dependency
        weight - the priority weight (1-256, only valid if streamDependency > 0)
        headerBlockFragment - the HPACK-encoded header block (a slice)

        Parameters:

        streamDependency - the stream this one depends on

        weight - the priority weight (1-256)
